text.content:
Death is as common as life, if not more so. Despite this, death and decay are considered subjects of the macabre, and those willing to dive headfirst into the fascinations they invoke are necromancers. These occult spellcasters seek the ever-changing borders of life and death, manipulating the energies—vitality and void—to suit their will. The undead both serve and cower before them. While a necromancer’s creations are merely a mockery of life, the undead are keen to serve their creator.

Key Attribute: INTELLIGENCE

At 1st level, your class gives you an attribute boost to Intelligence

Hit Points: 8 plus your Constitution modifier

You increase your maximum number of HP by this number at 1st level and every level thereafter.

During Combat Encounters...

You manipulate the flow of life and death on the battlefield. You both create and destroy your undead servants to amplify your occult magics. You also tip the scale by draining the life of your foes to heal your allies.

During Social Encounters...

Your knowledge of the occult and macabre can be both insightful and frightening. When natural charm fails, your magic can be just as potent at manipulating the living as it is the dead.

While Exploring...

You can locate haunts and other magical traps. Perhaps you summon the undead to trigger a trap you spotted or to serve as a decoy when you think enemies might be near.

In Downtime...

You can brew, craft magic items, or scribe scrolls for your party, and seek out knowledge about your grim fascination. Perhaps you tend to the local graveyard to ensure the dead are properly put to rest.

You Might...

  • Have a feverish desire to study the anatomy of creatures you discover along your journey.
  • Pay respects for the dead and the death you cause while understanding it is the inevitable end of all living creatures.
  • Seek ways to cheat the natural order of life and death either to make yourself immortal or bring back a loved one.

Others Probably...

  • Assume you enjoy the cruelty of death and revel in decay.
  • Seek you out hoping you can send or receive a message from a someone who has passed.
  • Ignore you, as your existence is a reminder that they and everyone they know will someday die.
  • Initial Proficiencies

Initial Proficiencies

At 1st level, you gain the listed proficiency ranks in the following statistics. You are untrained in anything not listed unless you gain a better proficiency rank in some other way.

Perception

Trained in Perception

Saving Throws

Expert in Fortitude

Trained in Reflex

Trained in Will

Skills

Trained in Occultism

Trained in a number of additional skills equal to 2 plus your Intelligence modifier

Attacks

Trained in simple weapons

Trained in unarmed attacks

Defenses

Trained in light armor

Trained in unarmored defense

Spells

Trained in spell attack modifier

Trained in spell DC

Class DC

Trained in necromancer class DC

Class Features

You gain these abilities as a necromancer. Abilities gained at higher levels list the level at which you gain them next to the features’ names.

Your LevelClass Features
1Ancestry and background, attribute boosts, initial proficiencies, necromancer spellcasting, grave spells, consume thrall, grim fascination, mastery of life and death, undead lore
2Necromancer feat, skill feat
32nd-rank spells, general feat, inevitable return, grim wards, skill increase
4Necromancer feat, skill feat
53rd-rank spells, attribute boosts, ancestry feat, reflex expertise, skill increase
6Necromancer feat, skill feat
74th-rank spells, expert necromancy, general feat, perception expertise, skill increase
8Necromancer feat, skill feat
95th-rank spells, ancestry feat, skill increase
10Attribute boosts, necromancer feat, skill feat
116th-rank spells, general feat, skill increase, unnatural fortitude, weapon expertise
12Necromancer feat, skill feat
137th-rank spells, ancestry feat, light armor expertise, skill increase, weapon specialization
14Necromancer feat, skill feat
158th-rank spells, attribute boosts, general feat, master necromancy, skill increase
16Necromancer feat, skill feat
179th-rank spells, ancestry feat, skill increase, undying resilience
18Necromancer feat, skill feat
19Epitaph, general feat, legendary necromancy, skill increase
20Attribute boosts, necromancer feat, skill feat

Ancestry and Background

In addition to the abilities provided by your class at 1st level, you have the benefits of your selected ancestry and background.

Attribute Boosts

In addition to what you get from your class at 1st level, you have four free boosts to different attribute modifiers. At 5th level and every 5 levels thereafter, you get four free boosts to different attribute modifiers. If an attribute modifier is already +4 or higher, it takes two boosts to increase it; you get a partial boost and must boost that attribute again at a later level to increase it by 1.

Initial Proficiencies

At 1st level, you gain a number of proficiencies that represent your basic training. These proficiencies are noted at the start of this class.

Necromancer Spellcasting

Necromancer FeatsLevel 2

At 2nd level and every even-numbered level thereafter, you gain a necromancer class feat.

Skill FeatsLevel 2

At 2nd level and every 2 levels thereafter, you gain a skill feat. You must be trained or better in the corresponding skill to select a skill feat.

General Feats Level 3

At 3rd level and every 4 levels thereafter, you gain a general feat.

Inevitable Return Level 3

@Embed[Compendium.pf2e-playtest-data.impossible-playtest-class-features.Item.qmWYDELLRVUqPGWS inline hr=false]

Grim Wards Level 3

@Embed[Compendium.pf2e-playtest-data.impossible-playtest-class-features.Item.xXJ8XpaCAqPCsh26 inline hr=false]

Skill Increases Level 3

At 3rd level and every 2 levels thereafter, you gain a skill increase. You can use this increase either to increase your proficiency rank to trained in one skill you're untrained in, or to increase your proficiency rank in one skill in which you're already trained to expert.

At 7th level, you can use skill increases to increase your proficiency rank to master in a skill in which you're already an expert, and at 15th level, you can use them to increase your proficiency rank to legendary in a skill in which you're already a master.

Ancestry Feats Level 5

In addition to the ancestry feat you started with, you gain an ancestry feat at 5th level and every 4 levels thereafter.

@Embed[Compendium.pf2e-playtest-data.impossible-playtest-class-features.Item.o8j4Bu8Bj8PuEkaJ inline hr=false]

At the heart of all communication is the word, and at the heart of all magic is the rune. Equal parts scholar and artist, you devote yourself to the study of these mystic symbols, learning to carve, etch, brand, and paint the building blocks of magic to channel powers greater than yourself.

Key Attribute: INTELLIGENCE

At 1st level, your class gives you an attribute boost to Intelligence.

Hit Points: 8 plus your Constitution modifier

You increase your maximum number of HP by this number at 1st level and every level thereafter.

During Combat Encounters...

You make a canvass of the battlefield, tracing beneficial runes onto your allies to strengthen and empower them while looking for opportunities to carve harmful runes onto those who oppose you. When the moment is right, you invoke your runes to bring their magic to life.

During Social Encounters...

Your knowledge of magical theory—if not practice—can translate into a surprising array of facts for any dialogue. Even if you're not the most persuasive, you might be able to support a more eloquent teammate with a subtly placed runic enchantment.

While Exploring...

You study ancient inscriptions on temple walls or lost artifacts to glean their history and forewarn your party. You take time to maintain runic inscriptions on your allies' gear, ensuring they'll be ready for the next encounter.

In Downtime...

You balance scholarly magical research with an ardent practice of your craft. You may begin each morning composing a poem or spend each afternoon toiling at a forge, your understanding of runes growing day by day.

You Might...

  • Pull from your study of languages and scripts in everyday conversation, using the odd word or maxim in an ancient language when the common tongue doesn’t quite suffice.
  • Personalize your magic items with small phrases or engravings that hold personal meaning.

Others Probably...

  • Ask for your assistance when a necklace clasp needs fixing or their armor needs resizing.
  • Think you a practitioner of magic, instead of just a humble scholar.

Initial Proficiencies

At 1st level, you gain the listed proficiency ranks in the following statistics. You are untrained in anything not listed unless you gain a better proficiency rank in some other way.

Perception

Trained in Perception

Saving Throws

Expert in Fortitude

Trained in Reflex

Expert in Will

Skills

Trained in Crafting

Trained in your choice of Arcana, Nature, Occultism, or Religion

Trained in a number of additional skills equal to 2 plus your Intelligence modifier

Attacks

Trained in simple weapons

Trained in martial weapons

Trained in unarmed attacks

Defenses

Trained in light armor

Trained medium armor

Trained in unarmored defense

Class DC

Trained in runesmith class DC

Ancestry and Background

In addition to the abilities provided by your class at 1st level, you have the benefits of your selected ancestry and background.

Attribute Boosts

In addition to what you get from your class at 1st level, you have four free boosts to different attribute modifiers.

At 5th level and every 5 levels thereafter, you get four free boosts to different attribute modifiers. If an attribute modifier is already +4 or higher, it takes two boosts to increase it; you get a partial boost, and must boost that attribute again at a later level to increase it by 1.

Initial Proficiencies

At 1st level, you gain a number of proficiencies that represent your basic training. These proficiencies are noted at the start of this class.

General Feats Level 3

Skill Increases Level 3

At 3rd level and every 2 levels thereafter, you gain a skill increase. You can use this increase either to increase your proficiency rank to trained in one skill you're untrained in, or to increase your proficiency rank in one skill in which you're already trained to expert.

At 7th level, you can use skill increases to increase your proficiency rank to master in a skill in which you're already an expert, and at 15th level, you can use them to increase your proficiency rank to legendary in a skill in which you're already a master.

Ancestry Feats Level 5

In addition to the ancestry feat you started with, you gain an ancestry feat at 5th level and every 4 levels thereafter.
